title.rendered: Best Places to Find Coliving Spaces If You Need A New Home in San Francisco

content.rendered:
The popularity of coliving has risen rapidly over the last few years. Coliving, in a nutshell, is when you share a living space with other people with shared interests.

There are multiple reasons why people choose coliving. It could be to combat loneliness, to build a professional network, or just to be part of a community. One of the prime reasons someone may choose coliving, however, is to cut down on rent and other living costs.

In a bustling city like San Francisco, for some, the rent costs can seem too high. If you also add the cost of utilities and food, there isn’t a lot of room left for other activities.

To maintain your lifestyle without compromising your savings, you may want to consider coliving in San Francisco over getting your own place. By opting for coliving, you get to meet different, like-minded people without long-term commitment.

The minimum stay period ranges between 30 to 90 days, with the option to extend. There’s also usually a great Wi-Fi connection, among several other benefits.

Related: What is Coliving and Why Should You Consider It?

We’re here to help you get started on your coliving journey, so let’s dive into where to find some of the best coliving spaces in San Francisco!

9 Places to Find Coliving in San Francisco

1. Roomi

Available in multiple cities across the world, Roomi is a free mobile app where you can find rooms, roommates, and coliving space listings all in one place!

Roomi can help you find some of the best coliving spaces in San Francisco with just a few taps in its app. Roomi also conducts a background check on all the applicants and listers and allows in-app messaging with potential homeowners to ensure both of your safety.

Browsing for a room or home on Roomi doesn’t require subscribing. However, some premium features that will help make house-hunting even more seamless do require a subscription. At just $29.99 per month or $14.99 per week, you can receive or send unlimited messages and save on flat booking fees!

Pros:

  • Most homes allow pets
  • Background checks on all users
  • In-app messaging to protect your privacy
  • Free to download; minimal fee to subscribe
  • Avoid booking fees on subscription
  • Diverse communities

Cons:

  • None found when researching user reviews

2. Tribe Coliving

Tribe is located at the center of downtown San Francisco and is an all-inclusive co-living space. You can opt for either a private or a shared room. The rent includes:

  • All utilities (electricity, water, waste, etc.)
  • Wi-Fi
  • Housekeeping services
  • Free laundry

All Tribe homes have multiple common areas like a gym, swimming pool, and lounges, where you can mingle with fellow residents.

Tribe is one of the few coliving spaces in San Francisco that hosts weekly events at their venue. These events include BBQs, game nights, and other networking events that you can take advantage of to accelerate your career.

Pros:

  • Diverse communities
  • All amenities included
  • Fully furnished homes
  • Flexible lease options

Cons:

  • You may face issues with cancelling your stay

3. June Homes

June Homes is a network of various coliving spaces in San Francisco, scattered across the city. The service allows you to rent short-term housing for an affordable price, without having to pay any brokerage fees.

Once rented, each June Homes space is refurbished according to the tenants’ individual needs. All June Homes spaces also come equipped with fully furnished options, all utilities, fast Wi-Fi and cable, bathroom, and cleaning essentials.

Pros:

  • All amenities included
  • Fully furnished homes
  • Flexible lease options

Cons:

  • You may face delay in receiving a response to queries

4. Japantown House

True to its name, Japantown House is located in Japantown, San Francisco. Experience the rich culture of Japan in this classy home, surrounded by delectable sushi and ramen restaurants.

There are also multiple karaoke bars and spas nearby to give you a much-needed break after a long work week.

With weekly housekeeping, in-house laundry, and Wi-Fi, the only considerable downside to be seen is the lack of private rooms. You can, however, rent shared rooms at a decent monthly price**.**

Pros:

  • All amenities included
  • Fully furnished homes
  • Chance to experience authentic East-Asian culture

Cons:

  • No private rooms

5. Bungalow

Similar to Roomi and June Homes, Bungalow is a portal where you can find suitable coliving spaces in San Francisco, whether you’re solo or with friends. Bungalow also vets all its users so there’s no room for guesswork, and streamlines the process of finding people to live with.

Bungalow is completely app-oriented. All the formalities related to finding and selecting your new home can be completed through its app itself. All you have to do is shortlist your apartments and meet the roommates.

Once everyone is in agreement, you’ll be invited to join the home through the Bungalow app. It also allows you to sign the lease right then and there. Avoid those awkward rent conversations by individually making your payments through the Bungalow app itself!

Pros:

  • All amenities included
  • Fully furnished
  • App-oriented

Cons:

  • Can face miscommunication issues with the team
  • Maintenance issues

6. Outsite

With Outsite Coliving in San Francisco, you have the option to choose from two charming homes.

The two spaces are located in Mission and Pacific Heights, which both offer multiple shared and private rooms, with bathrooms. The amenities include a reliable Wi-Fi connection, housekeeping services, a community manager, and 24/7 support, among other things.

Outsite’s coliving spaces in San Francisco also offer packages for groups (friends and family) and company retreats.

Pros:

  • All amenities included
  • Ideal for remote workers
  • Outdoor activities
  • Great for group retreats

Cons:

  • Not ideal for non-digital nomads
  • May be a bit pricey

7. The Excelsior House

Located just 10 miles from the Golden Gate Bridge, The Excelsior House is a 3-story home in the Excelsior district of San Francisco.

In this coliving space, you get a private bedroom plus bathroom, with a shared kitchen, laundry services, and weekly housekeeping. All amenities, including Wi-Fi, game/movie room, and backyard are included in the rent.

There are multiple shared spaces all over the house. However, unlike most coliving spaces in San Francisco, this place does not allow residents to host parties. Besides that, it also observes quiet hours and prohibits smoking.

Pros:

  • All amenities included
  • Diverse neighborhood
  • Close to the airport

Cons:

  • No parties allowed
  • No smoking zone

8. Common

Common offers around 9 different coliving spaces in San Francisco. Located around the San Francisco Bay Area, the Common houses provide fully furnished private bedrooms with a co-working space and more.

The very affordable rent prices include various amenities. The common features across all houses include regular cleaning, free laundry, Wi-Fi, and utilities.

Besides that, these spaces hold regular community events for their tenants where they can network or make new friends.

Pros:

  • All amenities included
  • Quick response time
  • Affordable

Cons:

  • May face issues with billing (rent)

9. Vybe Living

Vybe Living helps connect you to multiple living spaces and roommates. This coliving app screens its users before connecting them with each other and helps them find the most suitable places, fully furnished. Along with regular maintenance, the supply closets come fully stocked.

Similar to the others on the list, Vybe Living helps make coliving in San Francisco more fun by hosting regular community events.

Pros:

  • All amenities
  • Maintenance requests answered quickly
  • No hidden fees

Cons:

  • None found when researching user reviews

We hope this list helps you find your dream living situation! However, don’t make a decision based on just these pointers. It’s important to do your own research before you select a coliving space in San Francisco, because your comfort matters the most. Happy hunting!

Roomi helps you share a room or an entire home — on your terms. Welcome to the future of coliving! Browse hundreds of real people and places on Roomi for free. We verify every listing to ensure a safe searching experience.

Roomi is your one-stop option to list or find rooms, find roommates to settle into a new city easily. Download the app and sign up today!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
FIND ROOMMATES
